creditline: Gift of the Joseph F. McCrindle Collection
description: 4 small sheets, each with one figure, mounted together on a larger sheet; each study numbered (L to R): 70, 50, 111, 56; #70 (ULC): nude male with PR arm upraised, PL hand holding shield, weight on PL leg, PR leg extended back off the ground; #50 (URC): nude male from back, striding, looking back, with PR arm over head; #111 (LLC): seated nude with both hands on head; #56 (LRC): standing nude with PL foot on block, PR arm raised, looking down, holding an object in each hand
medium: Pen and brown ink and wash over red chalk
provenance: [Finchden Manor, Tenterden, Kent, 1976; sold, together with L2009.52.22 as "Roman School, circa 1620," for Â£180 GBP, to McCrindle]; Joseph F. McCrindle, New York (1976-d.2008); Joseph F. McCrindle Foundation (2008-2009; gave to MIA)
title: Four Studies of Male Nudes
